title: Drip Irrigation: Water Conservation and Produce Safety Video

tasks.task: Understanding and implementing drip irrigation systems for farm enhancement
subtasks: Learning about the benefits of drip irrigation (cost reduction, food safety, drought protection)
Understanding how drip irrigation systems work (slow and steady water delivery, emitters, soil surface application)
Considering when drip irrigation is not suitable (frost or freeze protection, crops requiring overhead watering)
Recognizing the reduced risk of pathogen contamination with drip irrigation
Inspecting the irrigation system to prevent contamination from soil insects or rodents
Managing water use and saving costs (reduce water and energy bills)
Using tools to automate and monitor water delivery (flow meters, timers, soil moisture sensors)
Being aware of potential salt buildup in high tunnels and managing fertilizer applications
Exploring financial assistance options from the USDA Natural Resource Conservation Service (EQIP and CSP)
Seeking technical expertise from NRCS and Extension for drip irrigation implementation
